page.title: 15HOUNSLOW HEATH
page.content: Hounslow Heath has a rich history. It has seen{highwaymen}like{Dick Turpin, a long-standing{army presence}and {London's first airport.}We tried to discover how it is used in 1985; we found a variety of uses. There was a rumour in school that part of it was a{secret anti-terrorist training area. When we investigated, we found a fenced-off area looking like a film set: house fronts, empty buildings and a full-size plane. In fact it is a{Metropolitan Police {training centre,}used to train constables in the sort of situation they meet working around London. The Heath is a big open area, mostly {grassland}but with a few trees and bushes. It is{mostly flat,}with a few dips. There are also some{ponds}and {wet areas.
